column5: siblings Hans and Sophie Scholl were caught distributing 1700 anti-Nazi leaflets at Munich University. They were arrested by the Gestapo and beheaded four days later. The executioner Johann Reichhart said later that he had never seen anyone die as bravely as Sophie. https://t.co/PtdTbL3Rkk>
column6: <Tweet id=1097402742337765376 text=1943年2月18日、ミュンヘン大学の学生による反ナチス運動「白いバラ：Die Weiße Rose）」のメンバーであったハンス・ショルとその妹ゾフィー・ショルがナチス批判のビラを配布した容疑で逮捕、翌日にはプロープストが逮捕され2.22の死刑判決の後、即日執行。のちに他の学生2名と教授1名も処刑された。 https://t.co/awagoqdkWC>

column4: siblings Hans and Sophie Scholl were caught distributing 1700 anti-Nazi leaflets at Munich University. They were arrested by the Gestapo and beheaded four days later. column1: 2. Ulotki na dziedzińcu Uniw. w Monachium https://t.co/AILIhk1ZNb>
column3: siblings Hans and Sophie Scholl were caught distributing 1700 anti-Nazi leaflets at Munich University. They were arrested by the Gestapo and beheaded four days later. The executioner Johann Reichhart said later that he had never seen anyone die as bravely as Sophie. https://t.co/PtdTbL3Rkk>
column4: <Tweet id=1494633316053565443 text=History has world-infamous villains. Then there are everyday villains like Jakob Schmid
column5: the caretaker who reported Hans and Sophie Scholl to the Gestapo OTD 79 years ago and thus condemned them to death.

column13: the weather is mild and sunny. Sophie Scholl would normally attend a physics lecture at 8am. This morning she doesn't show up.

column2: Mitglieder der Widerstandsgruppe #WeißeRose
column3: werden beim Verteilen von Flugblättern an der Münchner Universität beobachtet und verhaftet.

column2: <Tweet id=1494631529603026945 text=18 February 1943
column3: 11.15am | The caretaker
column4: Jakob Schmid
column5: apprehends Hans and Sophie Scholl. The Gestapo are called and the doors to the university locked to stop students leaving with the pamphlets.

column2: <Tweet id=1494627766217543690 text=18 February 1943
column3: 11am | It's not entirely clear why
column4: but Sophie Scholl pushes a pile of the pamphlets over the balustrade. The sheets of paper cascade down into the atrium below - just in time for them to be seen by the university caretaker.

column2: <Tweet id=1494625238373462017 text=18 February 1943
column3: 10.50am | Hans and Sophie Scholl deposit copies of the pamphlets around the empty atrium in the main university building (the 'Lichthof'). They work quickly. Students will soon be coming out of the lecture halls.

column2: <Tweet id=1494623980493283335 text=18 February 1943
column3: 10.45am | Hans Scholl and Sophie Scholl arrive at the main university building. They bump into Willi Graf and Traute Lafrenz who are heading off to their next lecture.

column2: <Tweet id=1494620204831330308 text=18 February 1943
column3: 10.30am | Hans Scholl and Sophie Scholl leave their apartment on Franz-Josef-Straße with a suitcase and briefcase full of pamphlets. They head in the direction of the main university building...

column2: <Tweet id=1494612661018914819 text=18 February 1943
column3: 10am | At the university
column4: Professor Kurt Huber begins his lecture. Willi Graf and another student involved in the resistance
column5: Traute Lafrenz
column6: are there. Sophie Scholl normally attends
column7: but this morning she doesn’t show up.

column2: <Tweet id=1494634422854946823 text=Sophie Scholl: soll ich an diesem völlig unbedeutenden 18.02.1943 an die Münchener Uni gehen und flugblätter verteilen.
